result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
1:45 PM Prosecuting attorney Mary Caitlin Brejcha in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Steven A Steffen in court.  Attorney J Andrew Herbers Jr. in court for Steven A Steffen. 

The State moves to dismiss and read into 22CM927.
The Court dismisses and reads into 22CM927.
Effective August 1, 2022, this case is assigned to Branch 7 Judicial Vacancy, pursuant to 22-SO-04(67).
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection.

records.addlTxt: Pre-trial conference on August 12, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 12, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

01:47 PM Defendant Steven A Steffen in court, in custody, with attorney  State Public Defender Law Intern.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender representation.  An attorney will be appointed.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  State is requesting WCS monitoring.  The Court will not order WCS monitoring at this time.
